meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids were smutching their clothes with mud.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic accidentally smutching the pristine white car with grease.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was smutching its paws all over the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: Her tears smutching her makeup as she wiped them away.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands were smutching the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A smudge or stain on something
meanings.sent1: There was a noticeable smutching on the mirror that needed cleaning.
meanings.sent2: The ink smutching on the paper made the writing difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's face was covered in chocolate smutching from the cake.
meanings.sent4: The smutching on the window blurred the view of the garden outside.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph had a smutching in the corner, adding character to the image.
